properties.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 2:40PM MST until February 13 at 4:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...QUICK HITTING SYSTEM TO BRING ADDITIONAL SNOW TO PARTS OF
NORTH-CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST NEW MEXICO THROUGH EARLY TONIGHT...

.Areas of light to occasionally moderate snow will expand across
far north-central and northeast New Mexico late this afternoon
into the early evening. The snow will taper off during the pre-
dawn hours Thursday. Primary travel concerns will be along I-25
near Raton Pass as well as high mountain passes in the northern
Sangre de Cristo Mountains.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches
favoring the highest terrain and areas near the Colorado line.

* WHERE...Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Johnson and
Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass.

* WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 4 AM MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM MST THURSDAY
